newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan auctions 200 mln rupees bonds, repos.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan auctions 200 mln rupees bonds, repos.

text.p: The State (central) Bank of Pakistan auctioned short-term federal investment bonds and five-month repos worth a total of 200 million rupees in a special open market operation on Sunday, a bank statement said.

It said bids worth 3.45 billion rupees were submitted for the outright sale of the six-month bonds, out of which bids worth 100 million rupees were accepted at a maximum cutt-off rate of 13.20 percent per annum.
Bids worth 100 million rupees were submitted for the repos and all were accepted at a maximum cut-off rate of 13.10 percent per annum, a bank statement said.

In the previous open market operation held on Wednesday, all bids worth 2.9 billion rupees were accepted for six-month bonds at a maximum cut-off rate of 13.25 percent per annum. All bids worth 4.0 billion were also accepted for the five-month maturity repos at a maximum cut-off of 13 percent per annum.
